channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2023090271
item.description:
Report E-2023090271

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCN experienced a UN3272 Disperbyk-161 release from a 55-gallon steel drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 53-gallons of material released to a 58’ x 10’ area of the concrete lot below the dock and a 15’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas and then collected into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The impacted trailer, concrete lot, and trench drain that flows to the onsite OWS were all pressure washed. All impacted water and skimmed material from the trench drain were collected and containerized into an additional 55-gallon metal drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090239
item.description:
Report E-2023090239

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 5, 2023, one (1) 30-liter container of UN3082 was damaged during transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and surfaces beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces of the trailer and worked them in with hand tools. TLE personnel utilized a plug and patch kit on the eight (8) gallon damaged drum of brake fluid and containerized it into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum as waste. All brake fluid-impacted material was collected and containerized in three (3) 35-gallon poly drums that stayed on-site in Cura's consolidated waste stream.

item.description:
Report X-2023081158

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-13
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023081158 SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. DescribePack: LOOSE SAFETY CAP ALLOWING LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR SOILING OTHER BOTTLES. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: WET PACKAGE WAS TAKEN OUT OF THE SYSTEM FLOW AND PLACED IN LINED TOTE. CAP WAS TIGHTENED TO MITIGATE FURTHER LIQUID RELEASE FROM OCCURING AND PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING. 2. X-2023081160 SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. DescribePack: NO INNER PACKAING ALLOWING MOVEMENT THIS ALLOWED LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR FROM LOOSE CAP AND FAILED SEAL. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: WET BOX WAS TAKEN OUT OF THE SYSTEM FLOW AND PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023090142
item.description:
Report E-2023090142

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 7, 2023, at 0815 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Circle K Landstar personnel in Cincinnati, Ohio regarding the release of approximately 40 gallons of Perchlorethylene (Tetrachloroethylene (Marine pollutant), UN18976.1, III). The release was contained to the trailer floor and asphalt beneath the trailer. Terminal personnel felt comfortable cleaning up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated was staged onsite pending the shipper's disposition and pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023090122
item.description:
Report E-2023090122

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 25, 2023, one (1) 55-pound bag of UN3378 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. TLE personnel utilized a hand vacuum unit to collect the released product, then used absorbent pads and a degreasing cleaner to wipe down the trailer floor and the impacted freight. The freight was repalletized for further shipment. The damaged bags, collected product, and miscellaneous waste were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon vented poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023090057
item.description:
Report E-2023090057

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-13
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: WORLD FUEL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 8/13/2023, a World Fuel Services, Inc. (WFS) tanker truck and driver were dispatched to the American Heritage vessel located at the Public Landing in downtown Cincinnati, OH for a delivery. The WFS driver arrived on site around 0830 and completed site inspection with vessel personnel, then begin the delivery. At approximately, 0900 the WFS driver saw product leaking from the truck’s pumping equipment and immediately hit the emergency shut off stopping product flow. Five gallons of No. 2 diesel fuel spilled from piping where a gasket had ruptured between the truck’s meter and pump. The spill impacted the concrete parking lot and up to a gallon of diesel impacted the Ohio River at mile marker 469.9. Both WFS and the vessel personnel took action to contained and the cleaned up the spill. The vessel deployed a boom and WFS used spill pads to contained the spill. The WFS driver notified the Cincinnati Operations Manager who then notified the HSSE Manager at 0930. Additional WFS personnel and the Operations Manager were deployed to site with spill cleaned up supplies at this time. And, HEPACO, WFS OSRO, was notified and dispatched to the site. WFS notified the NRC at 0955 of the incident. The Ohio EPA and the Hamilton EMA were notified of the spill between 1008 and 1015. By 1100 the spill had been cleaned up. The spill was cleaned up using absorbent booms, oil dry, and spills pads. Both WFS and vessel personnel cleaned up the spill and HEPACO was called off. The tanker unit was placed out of service until repairs could be completed. WFS later completed the delivery with different equipment, demobilize, and left the site.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver noticed the package was leaking and requested help from QA. Gloves, goggles, and aprons were acquired and moved the package into a line tote. Package was then transported to an isolated location. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was discovered that there was no inner packaging and a lid of one of the bottles had come off causing the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a lined tote upright and moved to a hazmat area.

item.title: Report X-2023081601
item.description:
Report X-2023081601

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

Report I-2023080016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: EAST LIVERPOOL
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HERITAGE TRANSPORT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The back gate of a parked dump trailer was partially opened to check for the presence of a liner. The operator was unaware that the trailer contained waste materials. After opening, waste materials were released from the gate onto the parking lot. The gate was closed with assistance of a fork truck, which stopped the release. Released materials were cleaned up promptly using onsite resources and placed into containers for subsequent management.
